titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University and Cornell Medical College Biomedical Seminars
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University and Cornell Medical College Biomedical Seminars FA844

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-09-20 00:58:52 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University and Cornell Medical College Biomedical Seminars

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Each lecture has a specific set of use conditions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

did.unittitle: Paul Talalay. Physiology of reproduction. Steroid biosynthesis and metabolism

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for scholary research.

RAC is unable to provide access to the original item, due to the specialized equipment necessary to facilitate playback. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply. See RAC Head of Archival Services or RAC Head of Digital Programs for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Each lecture has a specific set of use conditions.
